entry.title: Barcelona 2013: The Gaudi Experience
entry.summary: Gaudi, the name you hear often when mentioning Barcelona, and quite rightly…
entry.content:
Gaudi, the name you hear often when mentioning Barcelona, and quite rightly so. One visit to the fantasy buildings of Park Güell and you can enjoy the serenity of this man’s clever architectural design, I actually felt as if I was an extra in the Hansel and Gretel fairy tale! take a look at picture 24 towards the end of this set to see what I mean.

His most famous building the La Sagrada Famila, which is still being built today, left me blow away when I walked up the steps from the Sagrada Família metro for the first time, pictures don’t really do it justice, from the extraordinary Passion Facade figures on the outside to the beautiful colour’s coming off the stained windows once our inside ~ what a masterpiece!

La Sagrada Famila Photos

Park Guell Photos

Palau Guell Photos

Guell Pavilions Photos

Casa Mila (La Pedrera) Photos

Casa Batllo Photos

entry.title: Barcelona 2013: Montserrat & Montjuic
entry.summary: Taking a welcome trip out the hustle & bustle of central Barcelona…
entry.content: Taking a welcome trip out the hustle & bustle of central Barcelona I visited Santa Maria de Montserrat Abbey which is about an hour by train from central. The mountain monastery  is another awe-inspiring place to check out and you getting to it requires a ride on a cable car (or funicular if you don’t like heights), after a visit to the church and taking in the views I headed up on the other funicular and into the mountain trails, climbing around those in just trainers was a memory I’ll never forget! but let’s just say there were a few ‘slip here and it’s adios amigo’ moments..

entry.title: Barcelona 2013: Tibidabo & City
entry.summary: Ahh.. Barcelona! well it’s every bit as good as your friends &…
entry.content:
Ahh.. Barcelona! well it’s every bit as good as your friends & guidebooks tell you! being my first time there I booked up a whole week to explore the place and that what I did. Before heading off on my travels I saw a photo of the Temple del Sagrat Cor, it kinda reminded me of the Christ the Redeemer statue in Brazil and I loved the angle of the shot the photographer had taken ~ I wanted this photograph! and I’m glad to say I got it (first photo of this set) ~ getting all that church into one photo requires going up in an unusual bit of machinery! I do have a picture but I’m gonna leave it to the imagination, just like when I first saw the pic back home..

General Barcelona City Photos

Tibidabo Photos

entry.title: Italy Trip 2012: Verona
entry.summary: 'O Romeo, Romeo! wherefore art thou Romeo’ I’ve been to Verona before and that was only…
entry.content: 'O Romeo, Romeo! wherefore art thou Romeo’ I’ve been to Verona before and that was only due to a past girlfriends love of Shakespeare, this place ended up on our travel itinerary back then and I’m glad it did ~ what a great city! it kinda reminds me of a Italian version of London, lot’s going on, great architecture but minus the gloomy bits ~ the Arena is still has the romanesque quality about it, Lamberti Tower has some great views of the city & Juliet’s balcony is still adorned by love struck teenagers (and adults alike).

entry.title: Italy Trip 2012: Lake Garda
entry.summary: I stayed in Riva del Garda which is at the very most north…
entry.content: I stayed in Riva del Garda which is at the very most north of Lake Garda if your coming from Verona, quite a bus journey and I didn’t arrive until dark so missed all the beautiful scenery on the way there, waking up in the morning and heading outside more than made up for that though! I was right on the edge of the Italian Alps with the huge Lake Garda in front of me, I spent five days exploring the little towns on this vast lake by boat. Beautiful place.

entry.title: Italy Trip 2012: Venice
entry.summary: When I was planning this trip to Lake Garda, it occurred to me that…
entry.content: When I was planning this trip to Lake Garda, it occurred to me that I could possibly squeeze in a couple of days visit to Venice and also Verona on the way back, I have been to both these places before but never with a decent camera! and as before, the weather in Venice was up and down (a week later it was flooded! a lucky escape indeed..), but you don’t really worry about the weather when in such a magnificent city on water! just getting the train across the long bridge over the lagoon and being greeted by water buses is enough to get the adventure fest going..

entry.title: Tokyo 2011: Attraction - Travel Tickets
entry.summary: To accompaniment the photos from Tokyo I’ve dug out some of the…
entry.content: To accompaniment the photos from Tokyo I’ve dug out some of the printed memorabilia from that trip and have arranged it for you to view it in this section.

entry.title: Tokyo 2011: Nikko Shrines & Temples, Shinkyo Bridge & Kegon Falls
entry.summary: Recommended by a friend of mine who regularly visits Tokyo and seemingly…
entry.content:
Recommended by a friend of mine who regularly visits Tokyo and seemingly praised by every guidebook on the city, I booked this trip to Nikko Shrines & Temples World Heritage Site a few days in advance and set off for the early start of 7am for a full days trip. Situated in the mountains two hours away from central Tokyo, Nikko is quite literary a breath of fresh air from the city, and upon arrival your see & feel (pretty chilly) that your 543 meters above sea level. Being up in the mountains in the month of November has it’s advantages, all those awesome warm colours you get to see when walking through the shrines makes the whole visit even more spectacular! After wandering through the two shrines, Tosho-gu & Taiyuin-byo, I headed back into the small village of Nikko to see Shinkyo Bridge where legend has it was made from two giant snakes that rolled off the arm of a 10 foot god named Jinja-Daiou! Then I jumped on a bus to visit Kegon Falls, one of Japan’s three highest waterfalls and even though it was getting pretty cold by by that time (only having a summer coat was not the best idea..) it was well worth a look! This whole day trip was another highlight of my trip to Japan and I too would recommend this as a definite place to check out if your visiting Tokyo!

General Nikko Photos

Toshogu Shrine Photos

Shinkyo Bridge Photos

Kegon Waterfall Photos

entry.title: Tokyo 2011: Harajuku, Meiji Jingu & Ueno
entry.summary: After a long but ‘made-to-feel-comfortable’ 12hr flight with Japanese airline ANA, I…
entry.content:
After a long but ‘made-to-feel-comfortable’ 12hr flight with Japanese airline ANA, I made the total schoolboy error of boarding the wrong train from Narita airport to get to my hotel destination of Asakusa (have you seen the Tokyo subway map?!) getting off that train I waited at the the correct station and sat sitting on the platform contemplating why there were so many Japanese people on the train wearing surgical masks and pretty much all of them fiddling with their mobile phones, whilst listening to the calming bird sounds being played peacefully over the tannoy system at nine o’clock at night! ~ welcome to Japan!

It is near impossible to describe the wonderful & exciting world of Tokyo city in just a few paragraphs, in fact words are just not gonna do the place justice, an actual visit is required, besides, between first discovering that my hotel was only capable of hiring out Windows 98 laptops with just an ethernet connection, no Wi-Fi anywhere! (and in one of the most technology advanced city’s in the world!), using toilets that automatically hair dry yer bum, all the beautiful temples hidden amongst uber modern buildings, drinking whiskey & playing hungry hippos with real life manga models, expertly crafted plastic food, randomly being invited to dine with a highly successful business man and his two daughters & the eerie silence you get when eating in western fast food restaurants, plastic food! did I mention that?? I could just go on, and on.. and on.. but, trust me, go there, you won't regret it!

Harajuku Photos

Meiji Jingu Photos

Ueno Photos

entry.title: Tokyo 2011: Akihabara, Asakusa, Shibuya, Shinjuku & Roppongi Hills
